CSS_counter-styleSymbols.summary: The symbols CSS descriptor of the @counter-style at-rule is used to specify the symbols for creating counter representations in the specified counter system. Specifying this descriptor is mandatory when the value of the '@counter-style/system' descriptor is cyclic, numeric, alphabetic, symbolic, or fixed.

remarks.para:
-@counter-style descriptors: @counter-style/system, @counter-style/additive-symbols, @counter-style/negative, @counter-style/prefix, @counter-style/suffix, @counter-style/range, @counter-style/pad, @counter-style/speak-as, @counter-style/fallback
-List style properties: list-style, list-style-image, list-style-position
-symbols function
-url function
-CSS counter styles module

CSS_counter-styleSymbols.value:
The symbols descriptor is specified as a list of one or more space-separated <symbol> values.
NOTENote: When using an identifier for a symbol, note that ASCII non-letters such as *, ", and \ are not considered identifiers. They must be either quoted as a string or escaped.
